description: a(n)=(1/2)*Sum{|d(i)-e(i)|} where Sum{d(i)*2^i} is base 2 representation of n and e(i) are digits d(i) in reverse order.
comments: a(n)=least number of digits for which the change 0->1 in (binary n) yields a palindrome.a(n) = sum(abs(A030308(n,k)-A030308(n,A070939(n)-k)): k=0..A070939(n)/2-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 09 2013a(n) = sum((A030308(n,k)+A030308(n,A070939(n)-k)) mod 2: k=0..A070939(n)/2-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 18 2013

mathematica: a[n_] := (bits = IntegerDigits[n, 2]; Total[Abs[bits - Reverse[bits]]]/2); Table[a[n], {n, 1, 90}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 16 2013 *)
